column4: I somehow am not in the sudo users file anymore, what can I do to fix this other than re-installing Ubuntu.
magpile I said I have been removed from the sudo list, that doesnt work
why the hell does ubuntu have to complicate debian
and how do you get into root? never set a root password or account for that matter of fact
you can't, root account has no valid password. why did you remove yourself from the sudoer file in the first place?
im not tryin to hack anything
and I never removed myself tfomr the sudoer file
like I said the damn OS is saying im not a sudo user any more
does the 'groups' command say you are in the admin group?
is not in the sudoers file.  This incident will be reported.
not no more by the looks of iit
with the graphical tool or from the command line?
would sdb be set if he had master slave to slave?
it was thru an ssh connection, so command line
ok, then you must have used the wrong command, as none of the tools in ubuntu remove yourself from admin group automatically
